com.stormpath.shiro.authz

Interface PermissionsEditor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CustomDataPermissionsEditor

    public interface PermissionsEditor
    A PermissionsEditor allows one to read and manipulate (append or remove) permissions on an underlying data structure.

    The primary default implementation of this interface is the CustomDataPermissionsEditor, which reads and modifies a Set of permissions stored in an CustomData instance.

    Since:
    0.5
    See Also:
    CustomDataPermissionsEditor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PermissionsEditor append(String perm)
      Adds a Shiro permission String to the associated Set of permission strings.
      Set<String> getPermissionStrings()
      Returns a read-only (immutable) view of the stored permission strings.
      PermissionsEditor remove(String perm)
      Removes the specified Shiro permission String from the associated Set of permission Strings.

    • Method Detail

      • append

        PermissionsEditor append(String perm)
        Adds a Shiro permission String to the associated Set of permission strings.
        Parameters:
        perm - the permission string to add to the associated Set of permission strings.
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.

      • remove

        PermissionsEditor remove(String perm)
        Removes the specified Shiro permission String from the associated Set of permission Strings.
        Parameters:
        perm - the permission string to remove from the associated Set of permission strings.
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.

      • getPermissionStrings

        Set<String> getPermissionStrings()
        Returns a read-only (immutable) view of the stored permission strings. An immutable empty set will be returned if there are not any currently stored.
        Returns:
        an immutable view of the stored permission strings.
